title: Ticket #5310: Subsystem-specific config params sometimes ignored
description:
If a configuration parameter is set to something other than the default, and then the default value is set for a specific subsystem, the subsystem-specific setting is ignored. If the subsystem-specific value is different than the default, then it is treated as expected.

For example, take a config file that contains the following: 

# The default in the param table is False
USE_SHARED_PORT = True
SCHEDD.USE_SHARED_PORT = False
STARTD.USE_SHARED_PORT = 0

The value of USE_SHARED_PORT will be True everywhere, including in the schedd. 

% condor_config_val USE_SHARED_PORT
True
% condor_config_val -subsystem schedd USE_SHARED_PORT
True
% condor_config_val -subsystem startd USE_SHARED_PORT
0
%
